intro: Sida argentina var. argentina, commonly known as the Argentine sida, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in loose inflorescences. The species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
